intro: Jacquemontia cumanensis, commonly known as the Cumanensis morning glory, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species of vines and herbs. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while its vines can climb or sprawl along the ground. Jacquemontia cumanensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
